ids_info.name: edge_sources
ids_info.description: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux)

edge_sources/midplane.documentation: Choice of midplane definition (use the lowest index number if more than one value is relevant). Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux).

options.name: magnetic_axis
options.description: Midplane defined by the height of magnetic axis equilibrium/time_slice/global_quantities/magnetic_axis/z

options.name: dr_dz_zero_sep
options.description: Midplane defined by the height of the outboard point on the separatrix on which dr/dz = 0 (local maximum of the major radius of the separatrix). In case of multiple local maxima, the closest one from z=z_magnetic_axis is chosen. equilibrium/time_slice/boundary_separatrix/dr_dz_zero_point/z

options.name: z_zero
options.description: Midplane defined by z = 0

options.name: ggd_subset
options.description: Midplane location is specified by means of the GGD grid subset for the inner and outer midplanes, if the midplane choice is different from the other available options. If the GGD midplane subset corresponds to one of the other available options, select that particular option to indicate it

edge_sources/midplane/name.documentation: Short string identifier. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within midplane container: Choice of midplane definition (use the lowest index number if more than one value is relevant).

edge_sources/midplane/index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within midplane container: Choice of midplane definition (use the lowest index number if more than one value is relevant).

edge_sources/midplane/description.documentation: Verbose description. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within midplane container: Choice of midplane definition (use the lowest index number if more than one value is relevant).

edge_sources/grid_ggd/identifier.documentation: Grid identifier. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases.

options.name: unspecified
options.description: unspecified

options.name: linear
options.description: Linear

options.name: cylinder
options.description: Cylindrical geometry (straight in axial direction)

options.name: limiter
options.description: Limiter

options.name: SN
options.description: Single null

options.name: CDN
options.description: Connected double null

options.name: DDN_bottom
options.description: Disconnected double null with inner X-point below the midplane

options.name: DDN_top
options.description: Disconnected double null with inner X-point above the midplane

options.name: annulus
options.description: Annular geometry (not necessarily with straight axis)

options.name: stellarator_island
options.description: Stellarator island geometry

options.name: structured_spaces
options.description: Structured grid represented with multiple spaces of dimension 1

options.name: LFS_snowflake_minus
options.description: Snowflake grid with secondary x point on the low field side, and the secondary separatrix on top of the primary

options.name: LFS_snowflake_plus
options.description: Snowflake grid with secondary x point to the right of the primary, and the secondary separatrix below the primary

options.name: reference
options.description: Refers to a GGD described in another IDS indicated by grid_path. In such a case, do not fill the grid_ggd node of this IDS

edge_sources/grid_ggd/identifier/name.documentation: Short string identifier. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within identifier container: Grid identifier.

edge_sources/grid_ggd/identifier/index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within identifier container: Grid identifier.

edge_sources/grid_ggd/identifier/descrip.documentation: Verbose description. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within identifier container: Grid identifier.

edge_sources/grid_ggd/path.documentation: Path of the grid, including the IDS name, in case of implicit reference to a grid_ggd node described in another IDS. To be filled only if the grid is not described explicitly in this grid_ggd structure. Example syntax: #wall:2/description_ggd(1)/grid_ggd, means that the grid is located in the wall IDS, occurrence 2, with relative path description_ggd(1)/grid_ggd, using Fortran index convention (here : first index of the array). Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases.

edge_sources/grid_ggd/space.documentation: Set of grid spaces. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases.

edge_sources/grid_ggd/space/identifier.documentation: Space identifier. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces.

options.name: unspecified
options.description: unspecified

options.name: primary_standard
options.description: Primary space defining the standard grid

options.name: primary_staggered
options.description: Primary space defining a grid staggered with respect to the primary standard space

options.name: secondary_structured
options.description: Secondary space defining additional dimensions that extend the primary standard space in a structured way

edge_sources/grid_ggd/space/identifier/n.documentation: Short string identifier. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within identifier container: Space identifier.

edge_sources/grid_ggd/space/identifier/i.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within identifier container: Space identifier.

edge_sources/grid_ggd/space/identifier/d.documentation: Verbose description. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within identifier container: Space identifier.

edge_sources/grid_ggd/space/geometry_typ.documentation: Type of space geometry (0: standard, 1:Fourier, >1: Fourier with periodicity). Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces.

Short string identifier. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within geometry_type container: Type of space geometry (0: standard, 1:Fourier, >1: Fourier with periodicity).

Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within geometry_type container: Type of space geometry (0: standard, 1:Fourier, >1: Fourier with periodicity).

Verbose description. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within geometry_type container: Type of space geometry (0: standard, 1:Fourier, >1: Fourier with periodicity).

edge_sources/grid_ggd/space/coordinates_.documentation: Type of coordinates describing the physical space, for every coordinate of the space. The size of this node therefore defines the dimension of the space. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces.

options.name: unspecified
options.description: unspecified

options.name: x
options.description: First cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane

options.name: y
options.description: Second cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane (grad(x) x grad(y) = grad(z))

options.name: z
options.description: Vertical coordinate z

options.name: r
options.description: Major radius

options.name: phi
options.description: Toroidal angle

options.name: psi
options.description: Poloidal magnetic flux

options.name: rho_tor
options.description: The square root of the toroidal flux, sqrt((Phi-Phi_axis)/pi/B0), where Phi is the toroidal flux and B0 is the vacuum magnetic field

options.name: rho_tor_norm
options.description: The square root of the normalised toroidal flux, sqrt((Phi-Phi_axis)/(Phi_lcf-Phi_axis)), where Phi is the toroidal flux

options.name: rho_pol
options.description: The square root of the poloidal flux, sqrt(psi-psi_axis), where psi is the poloidal flux

options.name: rho_pol_norm
options.description: The square root of the normalised poloidal flux, sqrt((psi-psi_axis)/(psi_lcf-psi_axis)), where psi is the poloidal flux

options.name: theta
options.description: Geometrical poloidal angle around the magnetic axis

options.name: theta_straight
options.description: Straight field line poloidal angle

options.name: theta_equal_arc
options.description: Equal-arc poloidal angle; a differential of the angle is proportional to the length of the corresponding arc in the poloidal plane.

options.name: velocity
options.description: Total velocity; modulus of the velocity vector

options.name: velocity_x
options.description: Velocity component in the x-direction

options.name: velocity_y
options.description: Velocity component in the y-direction

options.name: velocity_z
options.description: Velocity component in the z-direction

options.name: velocity_phi
options.description: Velocity component in the toroidal direction

options.name: velocity_parallel
options.description: Velocity component parallel to the magnetic field

options.name: velocity_perpendicular
options.description: Velocity perpendicular to the magnetic field

options.name: velocity_thermal
options.description: Velocity normalised to the local thermal velocity of the thermal ions (of the relevant species)

options.name: velocity_radial
options.description: Velocity component in the radial direction

options.name: momentum
options.description: Modulus of the relativistic momentum vector

options.name: momentum_parallel
options.description: Component of the relativistic momentum vector parallel to the magnetic field

options.name: momentum_perpendicular
options.description: Component of the relativistic momentum vector perpendicular to the magnetic field

options.name: canonical_momentum_phi
options.description: Canonical toroidal angular momentum

options.name: energy_hamiltonian
options.description: Hamiltonian energy, including both kinetic and potential energy

options.name: energy_kinetic
options.description: Kinetic energy

options.name: magnetic_moment
options.description: magnetic moment

options.name: lambda
options.description: Ratio, magnetic moment over hamiltonian energy

options.name: pitch_angle
options.description: Angle between the magnetic field and the velocity vector

options.name: pitch
options.description: Ratio, parallel velocity over total velocity

options.name: pitch_at_min_b
options.description: Pitch, ratio of parallel over perp. velocity, at the minimum value of the magnetic field strength along the guiding centre orbit

options.name: n_phi
options.description: Toroidal mode number, the wave vector toroidal component being defined as k_tor = n_tor grad phi where phi is the toroidal angle so that a positive n_tor means a wave propagating in the positive phi direction

edge_sources/grid_ggd/space/coordinates_.documentation: Short string identifier. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within coordinates_type container: Type of coordinates describing the physical space, for every coordinate of the space. The size of this node therefore defines the dimension of the space.

Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within coordinates_type container: Type of coordinates describing the physical space, for every coordinate of the space. The size of this node therefore defines the dimension of the space.

Verbose description. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within coordinates_type container: Type of coordinates describing the physical space, for every coordinate of the space. The size of this node therefore defines the dimension of the space.

edge_sources/grid_ggd/space/objects_per_.documentation: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces.

Set of objects for a given dimension. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within objects_per_dimension container: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described.

Set of  (n-1)-dimensional objects defining the boundary of this n-dimensional object. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within objects_per_dimension container: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described. Within object container: Set of objects for a given dimension.

Index of this (n-1)-dimensional boundary object. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within objects_per_dimension container: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described. Within object container: Set of objects for a given dimension. Within boundary container: Set of  (n-1)-dimensional objects defining the boundary of this n-dimensional object.

List of indices of the n-dimensional objects adjacent to the given n-dimensional object. An object can possibly have multiple neighbours on a boundary. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within objects_per_dimension container: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described. Within object container: Set of objects for a given dimension. Within boundary container: Set of  (n-1)-dimensional objects defining the boundary of this n-dimensional object.

Geometry data associated with the object, its detailed content is defined by ../../geometry_content. Its dimension depends on the type of object, geometry and coordinate considered. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within objects_per_dimension container: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described. Within object container: Set of objects for a given dimension.

List of nodes forming this object (indices to objects_per_dimension(1)%object(:) in Fortran notation). Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within objects_per_dimension container: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described. Within object container: Set of objects for a given dimension.

Measure of the space object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects,...). Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within objects_per_dimension container: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described. Within object container: Set of objects for a given dimension.

2D geometry data associated with the object. Its dimension depends on the type of object, geometry and coordinate considered. Typically, the first dimension represents the object coordinates, while the second dimension would represent the values of the various degrees of freedom of the finite element attached to the object. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within objects_per_dimension container: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described. Within object container: Set of objects for a given dimension.

Content of the ../object/geometry node for this dimension. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within space container: Set of grid spaces. Within objects_per_dimension container: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described.

options.name: unspecified
options.description: unspecified

options.name: node_coordinates
options.description: For nodes : node coordinates

options.name: node_coordinates_connection
options.description: For nodes : node coordinates, then connection length, and distance in the poloidal plane to the nearest solid surface outside the separatrix

options.name: edge_areas
options.description: For edges : contains 3 surface areas after uniform extension in the third dimension of the edges. Geometry(1) and geometry(2) are the projections of that area along the local poloidal and radial coordinate respectively. Geometry(3) is the full surface area of the extended edge

options.name: face_indices_volume
options.description: For faces : coordinates indices (ix, iy) of the face within the structured grid of the code. The third element contains the volume after uniform extension in the third dimension of the faces

options.name: face_indices_volume_connection
options.description: For faces : coordinates indices (ix, iy) of the face within the structured grid of the code. The third element contains the volume after uniform extension in the third dimension of the faces. The fourth element is the connection length. The fifth element is the distance in the poloidal plane to the nearest solid surface outside the separatrix

The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described. Within geometry_content container: Content of the ../object/geometry node for this dimension.

edge_sources/grid_ggd/grid_subset.documentation: Grid subsets. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases.

edge_sources/grid_ggd/grid_subset/identi.documentation: Grid subset identifier. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within grid_subset container: Grid subsets.

options.name: unspecified
options.description: unspecified

options.name: nodes
options.description: All nodes (0D) belonging to the associated spaces, implicit declaration (no need to replicate the grid elements in the grid_subset structure). In case of a structured grid represented with multiple 1D spaces, the order of the implicit elements in the grid_subset follows Fortran ordering, i.e. iterate always on nodes of the first space first, then move to the second node of the second space, ... : [((s1_1 to s1_end), s2_1, s3_1 ... sN_1), (((s1_1 to s1_end), s2_2, s3_1, ... sN_1)), ... ((s1_1 to s1_end), s2_end, s3_end ... sN_end)]

options.name: edges
options.description: All edges (1D) belonging to the associated spaces, implicit declaration (no need to replicate the grid elements in the grid_subset structure)

options.name: x_aligned_edges
options.description: All x-aligned (poloidally) aligned edges belonging to the associated spaces

options.name: y_aligned_edges
options.description: All y-aligned (radially) aligned edges belonging to the associated spaces

options.name: cells
options.description: All cells (2D) belonging to the associated spaces, implicit declaration (no need to replicate the grid elements in the grid_subset structure)

options.name: x_points
options.description: Nodes defining x-points

options.name: core_cut
options.description: y-aligned edges inside the separatrix connecting to the active x-point

options.name: PFR_cut
options.description: y-aligned edges in the private flux region connecting to the active x-point

options.name: outer_throat
options.description: y-aligned edges in the outer SOL connecting to the active x-point

options.name: inner_throat
options.description: y-aligned edges in the inner SOL connecting to the active x-point

options.name: outer_midplane
options.description: y-aligned edges connecting to the node closest to outer midplane on the separatrix

options.name: inner_midplane
options.description: y-aligned edges connecting to the node closest to inner midplane on the separatrix

options.name: outer_target
options.description: y-aligned edges defining the outer target

options.name: inner_target
options.description: y-aligned edges defining the inner target

options.name: core_boundary
options.description: Innermost x-aligned edges

options.name: separatrix
options.description: x-aligned edges defining the active separatrix

options.name: main_chamber_wall
options.description: x-aligned edges defining main chamber wall outside of the divertor regions

options.name: outer_baffle
options.description: x-aligned edges defining the chamber wall of the outer active divertor region

options.name: inner_baffle
options.description: x-aligned edges defining the chamber wall of the inner active divertor region

options.name: outer_PFR_wall
options.description: x-aligned edges defining the private flux region wall of the outer active divertor region

options.name: inner_PFR_wall
options.description: x-aligned edges defining the private flux region wall of the inner active divertor region

options.name: core
options.description: Cells inside the active separatrix

options.name: sol
options.description: Cells defining the main SOL outside of the divertor regions

options.name: outer_divertor
options.description: Cells defining the outer divertor region

options.name: inner_divertor
options.description: Cells defining the inner divertor region

options.name: core_sol
options.description: x-aligned edges defining part of active separatrix separating core and sol

options.name: full_main_chamber_wall
options.description: main_chamber_wall + outer_baffle(s) + inner_baffle(s)

options.name: full_PFR_wall
options.description: outer_PFR__wall(s) + inner_PFR_wall(s)

options.name: core_cut_X2
options.description: y-aligned edges inside the separatrix connecting to the non-active x-point

options.name: PFR_cut_X2
options.description: y-aligned edges in the private flux region connecting to the non-active x-point

options.name: outer_throat_X2
options.description: y-aligned edges in the outer SOL connecting to the non-active x-point

options.name: inner_throat_X2
options.description: y-aligned edges in the inner SOL connecting to the non-active x-point

options.name: separatrix_2
options.description: x-aligned edges defining the non-active separatrix

options.name: outer_baffle_2
options.description: x-aligned edges defining the chamber wall of the outer non-active divertor region

options.name: inner_baffle_2
options.description: x-aligned edges defining the chamber wall of the inner non-active divertor region

options.name: outer_PFR_wall_2
options.description: x-aligned edges defining the private flux region wall of the outer non-active divertor region

options.name: inner_PFR_wall_2
options.description: x-aligned edges defining the private flux region wall of the inner non-active divertor region

options.name: intra_sep
options.description: Cells between the two separatrices

options.name: outer_divertor_2
options.description: Cells defining the outer inactive divertor region

options.name: inner_divertor_2
options.description: Cells defining the inner inactive divertor region

options.name: outer_target_2
options.description: y-aligned edges defining the outer inactive target

options.name: inner_target_2
options.description: y-aligned edges defining the inner inactive target

options.name: volumes
options.description: All volumes (3D) belonging to the associated spaces, implicit declaration (no need to replicate the grid elements in the grid_subset structure)

options.name: full_wall
options.description: All edges defining walls, baffles, and targets

options.name: outer_sf_leg_entrance_1
options.description: y-aligned edges defining the SOL entrance of the first snowflake outer leg

options.name: outer_sf_leg_entrance_2
options.description: y-aligned edges defining the SOL entrance of the third snowflake outer leg

options.name: outer_sf_pfr_connection_1
options.description: y-aligned edges defining the connection between the outer snowflake entrance and third leg

options.name: outer_sf_pfr_connection_2
options.description: y-aligned edges defining the connection between the outer snowflake first and second leg

options.name: magnetic_axis
options.description: Point corresponding to the magnetic axis

options.name: outer_mid_plane_separatrix
options.description: Point on active separatrix at outer mid-plane

options.name: inner_mid_plane_separatrix
options.description: Point on active separatrix at inner mid-plane

options.name: outer_target_separatrix
options.description: Point on active separatrix at outer active target

options.name: inner_target_separatrix
options.description: Point on active separatrix at inner active target

options.name: outer_target_separatrix_2
options.description: Point on non-active separatrix at outer non-active target

options.name: inner_target_separatrix_2
options.description: Point on non-active separatrix at inner non-active target

edge_sources/grid_ggd/grid_subset/identi.documentation: Short string identifier. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within grid_subset container: Grid subsets. Within identifier container: Grid subset identifier.

Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within grid_subset container: Grid subsets. Within identifier container: Grid subset identifier.

Verbose description. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within grid_subset container: Grid subsets. Within identifier container: Grid subset identifier.

Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within grid_subset container: Grid subsets.

Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within grid_subset container: Grid subsets.

Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within grid_subset container: Grid subsets. Within element container: Set of elements defining the grid subset. An element is defined by a combination of objects from potentially all spaces.

Index of the space from which that object is taken. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Within object container: Set of objects defining the element.

edge_sources/grid_ggd/grid_subset/base.documentation: Set of bases for the grid subset. For each base, the structure describes the projection of the base vectors on the canonical frame of the grid. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within grid_ggd container: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases. For each base, the structure describes the projection of the base vectors on the canonical frame of the grid.

edge_sources/source.documentation: Set of source terms. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux).

edge_sources/source/identifier.documentation: Source term identifier (process causing this source term). Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within source container: Set of source terms.

options.name: unspecified
options.description: Unspecified source type

options.name: total
options.description: Combined source excluding time derivative

options.name: ohmic
options.description: Source from ohmic heating

options.name: collisional_equipartition
options.description: Collisional equipartition

options.name: radiation
options.description: Source from line + recombination assisted + bremsstrahlung

options.name: charge_exchange
options.description: Source from charge exchange. Charge exchange losses are negative sources

options.name: neutrals
options.description: Combined source from all plasma-neutrals interactions

options.name: total_linearized
options.description: Combined source (linearized) excluding time derivative

options.name: background
options.description: Background source

options.name: prescribed
options.description: Source prescribed from code input parameters

options.name: time_derivative
options.description: Source associated with time derivative

options.name: atomic_ionization
options.description: Source from atomic ionization

options.name: molecular_ionization
options.description: Source from molecular ionization/dissociation

options.name: ionization
options.description: Source from ionization (combined)

options.name: recombination
options.description: Source from recombination

options.name: compression
options.description: Internal energy source from compression

options.name: bulk_motion
options.description: Internal energy source correction for bulk motion

options.name: database
options.description: Source from database entry

edge_sources/source/identifier/name.documentation: Short string identifier. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within source container: Set of source terms. Within identifier container: Source term identifier (process causing this source term).

edge_sources/source/identifier/index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within source container: Set of source terms. Within identifier container: Source term identifier (process causing this source term).

edge_sources/source/identifier/descripti.documentation: Verbose description. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within source container: Set of source terms. Within identifier container: Source term identifier (process causing this source term).

edge_sources/source/species.documentation: Species causing this source term (if relevant, e.g. a particular ion or neutral state in case of line radiation). Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within source container: Set of source terms.

edge_sources/source/species/type.documentation: Species type. index=1 for electron; index=2 for ion species in a single/average state (refer to ion structure); index=3 for ion species in a particular state (refer to ion/state structure);  index=4 for neutral species in a single/average state (refer to neutral structure); index=5 for neutral species in a particular state (refer to neutral/state structure);  index=6 for neutron; index=7 for photon. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within source container: Set of source terms. Within species container: Species causing this source term (if relevant, e.g. a particular ion or neutral state in case of line radiation).

options.name: unspecified
options.description: unspecified

options.name: electron
options.description: Electron

options.name: ion
options.description: Ion species in a single/average state; refer to ion-structure

options.name: ion_state
options.description: Ion species in a particular state; refer to ion/state-structure

options.name: neutral
options.description: Neutral species in a single/average state; refer to neutral-structure

options.name: neutral_state
options.description: Neutral species in a particular state; refer to neutral/state-structure

options.name: neutron
options.description: Neutron

options.name: photon
options.description: Photon

edge_sources/source/ggd_fast/ion.documentation: Source term integrals related to the various ion species. Within edge_sources IDS: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux). Within source container: Set of source terms. Within ggd_fast container: Quantities provided at a faster sampling rate than the full ggd quantities. These are either integrated quantities or local quantities provided on a reduced set of positions. Positions and integration domains are described by a set of grid_subsets (of size 1 for a position).
